meanings.definition: The strings that attach the eyeballs to the eye sockets.
meanings.sent1: When I learned about eyestrings, I imagined tiny ropes holding my eyes in place.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained that the eyestrings are crucial for keeping the eyes in position.
meanings.sent3: I joked that if my eyestrings ever break, my eyes might roll away like marbles.
meanings.sent4: Her gaze was so intense, it felt like her eyestrings were pulling me closer.
meanings.sent5: The image of eyestrings connecting the eyes to the sockets stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: The muscles that control the movement of the eyeballs.
meanings.sent1: During the eye exam, the doctor checked the strength of my eyestrings.
meanings.sent2: The eyestrings work together to help the eyes look in different directions.
meanings.sent3: I playfully told my friend that I wish I could strengthen my eyestrings by blinking more.
meanings.sent4: Her eyestrings seemed to dance as she followed the moving object with her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The eyestrings flexed and relaxed as the eyes scanned the room.

meanings.definition: The nerves that transmit visual information from the eyes to the brain.
meanings.sent1: The eyestrings send signals to the brain about what the eyes see.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study how the eyestrings communicate with the brain to understand vision.
meanings.sent3: I imagined tiny messengers running along the eyestrings to deliver information to the brain.
meanings.sent4: Her eyestrings seemed to vibrate with excitement as she saw something surprising.
meanings.sent5: The eyestrings acted as the messengers of sight, carrying images to the brain.
